newsitem.title: PERU: Peru net reserves fall to $9.769 bln end of July.
newsitem.headline: Peru net reserves fall to $9.769 bln end of July.

text.p: Peru's Central Reserve Bank said Friday its net international reserves stood at $9.769 billion at the end of July, down from $9.996 billion the week before.

President Alberto Fujimori told Congress Monday reserves were at $10 billion. The reserves, which have climbed steadily during Fujimori's seven years in office, had never before reached the $10 billion mark.
Peru's reserves stood at $8.540 billion at the end of 1996.
